variants.Description in input context: c.248G>A (p.G83D) -  This variant causes a structural change in the protein, affecting its function, leading to reduced interaction with p300.
c.280C>T (p.Y94*) -  This variant introduces a premature stop codon leading to a truncated protein.
c.1371C>T (p.L457L) - A synonymous change, but affects mRNA stability due to altered splicing pattern.

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using the HEK293 cell line transfected with wild-type and mutant cDNA constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression was reduced by 60% for the variant NM_001126112.3:c.248G>A, coupled with decreased phosphorylation at Ser156.
No protein product was detected for the variant NM_001126112.3:c.280C>T.
mRNA stability was slightly affected, however protein expression and function of MDH1 were not significantly altered.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed, each involving separate transfections and assays.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate to minimize experimental error.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type cDNA was used as a positive control for protein expression.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control to verify specificity of antibodies.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used for statistical analysis. P < 0.05 was considered significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression between 80% and 120% of wild-type control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression outside the range of 80% to 120% of wild-type control.
